docs.title: Codex Account Manager
docs.text: The Professional's Choice for Secure Multi-Account Management. Stop juggling API keys in plaintext files. Switch identities instantly, securely, and confidently.

docs.title: 🛑 The Problem: Quota Chaos & Key Fatigue
docs.text: Modern AI Development creates a new set of challenges: * Quota Limits: You have 3 different OpenAI/Codex accounts to manage 5h and Weekly limits. Hitting a limit mid-stream breaks your flow. * Context Risks: Accidentally running a heavy "Thinking Model" task on your personal limited account instead of the corporate unlimited plan. * Security Nightmares: Storing sensitive sk- keys in .env files scattered across projects is a leak waiting to happen.

docs.title: ✅ The Solution
docs.text: Codex Account Manager is your unified command center for AI credentials. It treats your identities as Profiles, not just text strings.

docs.title: Why Codex Account Manager?
docs.text:
🧠 Intelligent Quota Management Never hit a rate limit blindly again. The system tracks your 5-Hour and Weekly usage for every account in real-time. Know exactly which account has capacity before you switch.

⚡ Instant Context Switching Switch from "Personal (Limited)" to "Work (Pro)" in one keystroke. The CLI instantly injects the correct credentials into your environment, ensuring zero downtime when one account hits its cap.

🖥️ Native macOS Experience Always there, never in the way. Our native System Tray application sits quietly in your menu bar. * Glanceable Status: See your active account and usage usage bars directly in the menu. * One-Click Switch: Change identities without touching the terminal. * Global Hotkey: Bring up the dashboard instantly.

🛡️ Military-Grade Security Your credentials are never stored in plaintext. We use AES-256 encryption strictly permission-locked (chmod 600), ensuring only you have access.

docs.title: 🚀 Features
docs.text:
• Universal Proxy: Inject credentials into any command (codex-account run -- python script.py) without polluting your global environment.
  • Audit Logging: Every access is logged locally. Know exactly when and which key was used.
  • Legacy Migration: Effortlessly import accounts from older project structures.
  • Terminal UI: Forget the names? Browse your vault with a beautiful interactive TUI.
  • Git Sync: Keep your encrypted vault synchronized across all your devices using any private Git repo.

docs.title: 📦 Installation
docs.text:
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/salacoste/codex-account-switch-backups.git
cd codex-account-manager

# Install with Poetry
poetry install
poetry shell

docs.title: 🛠️ Quick Start
docs.text:
1. Initialize your vault 

codex-account init

2. Add your first account 

codex-account add work-prod --email me@corp.com --api-key sk-secure-123

3. Switch Context 

codex-account switch work-prod
# You are now authenticated as 'work-prod'

4. Check Status & Usage 

codex-account list
# Shows: Active | Name | Type | Usage (5h/W) | Tags

docs.title: 🔒 Security Note
docs.text: This tool manages sensitive API keys. * Storage is rooted at ~/.codex-accounts/. * Files are readable only by the user (0600). * Avoid running as root.

docs.title: Codex Account Manager: User Guide
docs.text: Welcome to the Codex Account Manager! This guide covers everything you need to know to install, configure, and use the tool effectively.

docs.title: 📚 Table of Contents
docs.text:
1. Installation
  2. Getting Started
  3. Daily Workflow

  5. Universal Proxy (Run)
  6. Context Awareness
  7. Data Portability & Sync
  8. Security & Auditing
  9. Troubleshooting

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.9 or higher
  • Pip (Python Package Installer)

docs.title: Install via Pip
docs.text:
If you have the .whl file (from the build): 

pip install codex_account_manager-1.0.0-py3-none-any.whl

docs.title: Install from Source
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/your-org/codex-account-backups.git
cd codex-account-manager
poetry install
poetry shell

docs.title: Initialize Storage
docs.text:
Before using the tool, you must initialize the secure storage vault. This creates the ~/.codex-accounts directory with secure permissions (0600).

codex-account init

docs.title: Add Your First Account
docs.text:
You can add an account using the interactive wizard: 

codex-account add
Follow the prompts to enter: * Name: A unique nickname (e.g., work, personal). * Email: Your registered email (e.g., alice@example.com). * API Key: Your Codex API Key (sk-...).

docs.title: Switching Accounts
docs.text:
The core feature of this tool is Context Switching. When you switch accounts, the tool updates the central ~/.codex/auth.json file used by the Codex CLI.

Command: 

codex-account switch <name>

Example: 

codex-account switch work
# You are now authenticated as "work"

docs.title: Checking Status
docs.text:
Unsure which account is active? 

codex-account status
Output: 
✅ Active Identity: work (alice@work.com)

docs.title: Interactive Selection (TUI)
docs.text:
If you forget your account names, use the interactive browser: 

codex-account tui
Use Arrow Keys to highlight an account and Enter to switch.

docs.title: Tagging Accounts
docs.text:
Group your accounts logically using tags (e.g., v1, v2, prod, dev).

Add with Tags: 

codex-account add project-x --tag dev --tag cloud-v2

docs.title: Filtering Lists
docs.text:
View only relevant accounts: 

codex-account list --tag dev

docs.title: 5. Universal Proxy (Run Command)
docs.text: The superpower of Codex Account Manager is the ability to inject credentials into any other CLI tool without manual exports.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
Use codex-account run to wrap your target command.

# Injects CODEX_API_KEY and CODEX_ACCESS_TOKEN
codex-account run -- python deploy.py

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
You can attach arbitrary environment variables (like AWS keys, Database URLs) to an account.

Add Variable: 

codex-account env add AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID AKIA...
codex-account env add AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY wJal...

Run with Vars: 

codex-account run -- aws s3 ls

docs.title: 6. Context Awareness
docs.text: Stop switching accounts manually. Link directories to specific identities.

docs.title: Link Directory
docs.text:
cd ~/projects/client-alpha
codex-account context set client-alpha
Now, this directory is permanently linked to client-alpha.

docs.title: Session Override
docs.text:
You can also override the account for a specific terminal session (useful for temporary work):

export CODEX_ACTIVE_ACCOUNT=personal
codex-account run -- ./script.sh  # Uses 'personal' regardless of global settings

docs.title: 7. Data Portability & Sync
docs.text: Keep your accounts backed up and synchronized across devices.

docs.title: Manual Backup (Zip)
docs.text:
# Access denied? Encryption protects your data.
codex-account export --output ./backup.zip
# Restore
codex-account import ./backup.zip

docs.title: Git Sync (Recommended)
docs.text:
Sync your encrypted vault to a private Git repository.

Setup: 1. Create a private repo (e.g., on GitHub/GitLab). 2. Initialize sync: 

codex-account sync init git@github.com:me/my-vault.git

Workflow: 

codex-account sync push  # Upload changes
codex-account sync pull  # Download changes

docs.title: 8. Security & Auditing
docs.text: Track who accessed your keys and when.

docs.title: View Audit Log
docs.text: codex-account audit

docs.title: Filter Logs
docs.text: codex-account audit --limit 10 --account work

docs.title: "Permission Denied" Errors
docs.text:
Ensure your ~/.codex-accounts directory has correct permissions. Fix it manually: 

chmod 700 ~/.codex-accounts
chmod 600 ~/.codex-accounts/*/auth.json

docs.title: "Account Not Found"
docs.text: Run codex-account list to see available names. Names are "slugified" (e.g., "My Account" becomes "my-account").

docs.title: Manual Recovery
docs.text: If the tool breaks, your data is stored in standard JSON files at ~/.codex-accounts/. You can back up or inspect this directory manually (requires root or user permissions).

docs.title: 10. Agile Teams (Team Vaults)
docs.text: Collaborate securely with shared team vaults.

docs.title: Join a Team
docs.text:
You need the Team Name, Git URL, and the Team Master Key (from your admin).

codex-account team join ops git@github.com:my-org/ops-vault.git
Enter the Team Master Key when prompted.

docs.title: Access Team Accounts
docs.text:
Team accounts are namespaced: team-name/account-name.

# List all accounts (Personal + Teams)
codex-account list

# Switch to a team account
codex-account switch ops/aws-prod
The tool handles fetching the correct encryption key automatically.

docs.title: Image Generation Prompts for Nanobanano Pro
docs.text: Use these prompts to generate high-quality marketing assets for the Codex Account Manager README. Unified Style Guide: * Aesthetic: "Cyberpunk Enterprise" – A blend of high-tech security and modern SaaS cleanliness. * Color Palette: Deep Matte Black background (#111), Neon Teal (#00E5FF) for active elements, Deep Purple (#7C4DFF) for security accents. * Lighting: Cinematic, volumetric lighting with soft bloom. High contrast but clean lines. * Vibe: Trustworthy, encryption, speed, organized.

docs.title: 1. Hero Banner (The Secure Vault)
docs.text:
Placement: Top of README. Goal: Convey "Military-grade security in a modern package".

Prompt:

[Nanobanano Pro] Subject: A majestic, hyper-realistic 3D visualization of a digital vault floating in a dark, infinite data void. The vault is represented by a translucent, crystalline padlock glowing with an inner teal light, protected by rotating rings of golden and purple cryptographic code. Details: Surrounding the central lock are sleek, metallic data pipes connecting to "floating islands" representing different development environments (Cloud, Local, Staging), all securely tethered to the center. Style & Atmosphere: Cinematic 3D render (Octane Render style), depth of field focusing on the lock. The lighting should be dramatic, with a strong rim light highlighting the edges of the lock against the deep black background. No text. Colors: Dominant Deep Black, Accents of Cyan and Royal Purple. Aspect Ratio: 16:9 (Landscape)

docs.title: 2. Feature Visualization (Chaos vs Order)
docs.text:
Placement: Under "The Solution". Goal: Visually demonstrate the pain of the "old way" vs the ease of the "new way".

Prompt:

[Nanobanano Pro] Subject: A sleek, split-screen composition contrasting "The Problem" vs "The Solution". Left Side (The Problem): A desaturated, slightly gritty view of a developer's cluttered workspace. Screens are filled with chaotic green text, sticky notes with "API KEY??" stuck to the monitor, and a tangle of red cables symbolizing confusion and risk. Lighting is dim and warm/yellow. Right Side (The Solution): A pristine, high-tech interface in a clean, cool-toned environment. A holographic shield floats above a keyboard, radiating a calm teal light. Organized data streams flow smoothly into a central hub. The lighting is crisp, white, and blue, emphasizing clarity and speed. Style: High-end concept art, isometric perspective. The transition line between left and right should be a sharp, glowing diagonal cut. Aspect Ratio: 16:9 (Landscape)

docs.title: 3. The CLI Experience (Terminal UI Mockup)
docs.text:
Placement: Under "Features". Goal: Showcase the tool's actual interface in a stylized, attractive way.

Prompt:

[Nanobanano Pro] Subject: A photorealistic close-up of a high-resolution MacBook Pro screen displaying a beautiful, modern terminal window. The terminal (using a glassmorphism effect) is running codex-account list. Screen Content: Inside the terminal, distinct, colorful rows of text show account statuses: "✅ Work-Prod [Active]" in bright green, "🔒 Personal [Encrypted]" in soft blue. Two horizontal progress bars labeled "Usage Limit" are visible, one at 40% (green), one at 90% (yellow). Environment: The laptop sits on a minimal dark-wood desk with soft, bokeh out-of-focus city lights in the background (purple/blue hues). Style: Premium product photography, macro lens focusing on the sharp typography of the terminal. Aspect Ratio: 16:9 (Landscape)
